<pb n="77"/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">A</hi> “London Rare Book Notes,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 139 (1941 [19 April]): 1677–78.<lb/>
Signed “Waynflete.”<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">A</hi> “Clough to Churchill: A Memorable Experience,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 140 (1941<lb/>
[2 August]): 309–11. On presenting to Churchill, on behalf of Charles Scrib-<lb/>
ner on 7 July 1941, the manuscript of Arthur Hugh Clough’s “Say not the<lb/>
struggle nought availeth,” from which Churchill had read two stanzas in his<lb/>
radio address of 27 April 1941. Cf. C:1941.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">L</hi> “Final Word on Housman Edition,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 140 (1941 [9 August]):<lb/>
381. Points out that an error in his <hi rend="italic">Colophon</hi> article (D:1938, Winter) was cor-<lb/>
rected in his “Annotated Check-List” (D:1940, September).<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">A</hi> “Stocktaking, 1941: An Old P.W. Contributor Looks at the Balance Sheet,”<lb/>
<hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 140 (1941 [20 December]): 2241–45. Covers the years since<lb/>
he began at Scribner’s, 1927–40.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">D</hi>:1942<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">L</hi> “The Prices of Imported Books,” <hi rend="italic">The Bookseller</hi>, 22 January 1942, p. 53. Re-<lb/>
printed as “Cost of Shipping to England Analyzed by Carter” in <hi rend="italic">Publishers’<lb/>
Weekly</hi> 141 (1942 [28 February]): 937.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">A</hi> “London Rare Book Notes,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 141 (1942 [21 February]): 896-<lb/>
97. Signed “Waynflete.”<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">O</hi> “Max Harzof,” <hi rend="italic">The Clique</hi>, 14 March 1942, p. 7.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">A</hi> “The British Book Trade in the Third Year of War,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 141<lb/>
(1942 [9 May]): 1744–47. Read at the opening session of the American Book-<lb/>
sellers’ Association convention by Cedric Crowell of Doubleday.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">N</hi> “A. E. Housman: An Annotated Check-List, Additions and Corrections,” <hi rend="italic">The<lb/>
Library</hi>, 4th series 23 (1942–43 [June 1942]): 42–43. By Carter and John Spar-<lb/>
row. See D:1940 (September).<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">A</hi> “London Rare Book Notes,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 142 (1942 [15 August]): 487–88.<lb/>
Signed “Waynflete.” In his account of the Bibliographical Society’s fiftieth-<lb/>
anniversary dinner at Magdalene College Cambridge, he says, “An austere<lb/>
collation was succeeded by encomiastic speeches.”<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">A</hi> “The Kern Copy of <hi rend="italic">Tom Jones</hi>: A Test Case in Federal Court,” <hi rend="italic">The Bookseller</hi>,<lb/>
27 August 1942, 194–96. By Carter and Percy H. Muir.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">L</hi> “The Star-Spangled Banner,” <hi rend="italic">The Times</hi>, 9 November 1942, p. 5.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">D</hi>:1943<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">O</hi> “The Rev. A. W. Evans: An Appreciation,” <hi rend="italic">The Times</hi>, 19 April 1943, p. 6.<lb/>
Unsigned. Reprinted in <hi rend="italic">The Clique</hi>, 1 May 1943, p. 9. Unsigned.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">A</hi> “London Rare Book Notes,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 143 (1943 [29 May]): 2074–76.<lb/>
Signed “Waynflete.”<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">L</hi> “Paper for Books,” <hi rend="italic">The Times</hi>, 13 October 1943, p. 5.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">L</hi> [Letter on his posting to New York as director of the General Division of British<lb/>
Information Services in New York], <hi rend="italic">The Clique</hi>, 16 October 1943.<lb/>
<hi rend="smallcaps">L</hi> [Letter on the posting of “Waynflete” to New York and his consequent inability<lb/>
to continue his column until after the war], <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 144 (1943 [20<lb/>
November]): 1962–63.<lb/>
